name: Saxe, Guardian of Estate of Samuel Rezits, a Lunatic, Appellant, v. Board of Revision of Taxes
name_abbreviation: Saxe v. Board of Revision of Taxes

judges: Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Drew and Linn, JJ.
parties: Saxe, Guardian of Estate of Samuel Rezits, a Lunatic, Appellant, v. Board of Revision of Taxes.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The judgment of the Superior Court is affirmed on the opinion of that court by Judge Baldrige, affirming the order of the court below.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Wesley H. Caldwell, with him Edward Weisglass, for appellant.
William T. Cooper, Assistant City Solicitor, and David J. Smyth, City Solicitor, for appellee, were not heard.
casebody.head_matter:
Saxe, Guardian of Estate of Samuel Rezits, a Lunatic, Appellant, v. Board of Revision of Taxes.
Argued April 20, 1933.
Before Frazer, C. J., Simpson, Kephart, Schaffer, Drew and Linn, JJ.
Wesley H. Caldwell, with him Edward Weisglass, for appellant.
William T. Cooper, Assistant City Solicitor, and David J. Smyth, City Solicitor, for appellee, were not heard.
May 22, 1933:
